document.docTitle: Xinjiangsha tarda Stekolnikov & Daniel 2012, comb. nov.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aboriginesia tarda, Kudryashova 1993b: 60
, fig. 4 ( lectotype designated); 1998: 236, fig. 196.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
SIF = 7BS-N-3-3111.1000; fPp = B/B/NNB; fCx = 1.1.1; fSt = 2.2; fSc: AM> PL ≥ PPL> AL; Ip = 715–828; fD = (4–6)H-[(8–14)-(6–10)]-[(8–13)-(5–9)]-(7–13)-…; DS = 60–78; VS = 37–47; NDV = 103–122. Standard measurements of lectotype ( Kudryashova 1998 ): AW 74, PW 95, SB 32, ASB 27, PSB 25, SD 52, P-PL 22, AP 29, AM 45, AL 36, PL 36, 40, PPL 38, S 67, H 41, 43, D min 27, D max 38, V min 27, V max 36, pa 257, pm 232, pp 263, Ip 752, DS 78, VS 44, NDV 122, TaIII 63. Standard measurements of 2 specimens from Turkey and 11 specimens from other localities are given in Table 2
.
Type material deposition. Lectotype and paralectotypes in ZMMU.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Standard measurements of
Xinjiangsha tarda
.

paragraph.tableNote: Note: For AM n = 9, for S n = 4, for pa, pm, pp, and Ip n = 10, for other variables n = 11, not counting 2 specimens from Turkey.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 13.
Xinjiangsha tarda ( Schluger, 1957 )
,
comb. nov.
(material from the collection site 10, 1998). A , scutum and eyes; B , arrangement of dorsal idiosomal setae; C , arrangement of ventral idiosomal setae. Scale bars: 50 µm ( A ), 100 µm ( B, C ).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Four paralectotypes ex
Chionomys nivalis
, RUSSIA : Dagestan , 12 and 14 August

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comparative material examined. Four larvae (ZMMU) ex
Prometheomys schaposchnikowi
, GEORGIA : Suat’isi ( 42° 37' 47" N , 44° 22' 55" E ), 24 August 1951 , coll. I.N. Razumova, det. E.G. Schluger;
2 larvae (ZISP) (not measured) ex
Chionomys nivalis
, ARMENIA : Shirak Prov. , Musayelyan ( 40° 45' 55" N , 43° 59' 27" E ,
1729 m a.s.l.
),
28 August 1979
, coll. I.V. Panova
;
3 larvae (ZISP) ex
Apodemus (Sylvaemus)
sp., RUSSIA : Karachay- Cherkessia , 5.8 km E from Pkhiya , 43° 35' 36" N , 41° 01' 19" E ,
1770 m a.s.l.
,
9 August 1995
, coll. AAS;
5 larvae (ZISP) (not measured) ex
Microtus (Terricola)
sp. and
A. ( Sylvaemus )
sp., RUSSIA : Kabardino-Balkaria , Bezengi gorge, 43° 09' 24" N , 43° 12' 12" E ,
1750 m a.s.l.
,
16 June 1996
, coll. AAS.

Material from Turkey examined.
Two larvae (ZISP) ex
Microtus majori
and
Apodemus (Sylvaemus)
sp., Artvin Prov. , 2.8 km NE from Marsis Mt, 2400 m a.s.l., 24 June 1998 , coll. AAS.

Hosts.
Chionomys gud (Satunin)
,
Ch. nivalis (Martins)
,
Microtus majori Thomas
,
Cricetulus migratorius (Pallas)
,
Prometheomys schaposchnikowi Satunin
,
Apodemus (Sylvaemus)
sp.

Distribution. Georgia , Russia ( North Ossetia , Dagestan ). Kudryashova (1993b , 1998 ) questioned the record of
X. tarda
from Azerbaijan ( Mulyarskaya 1968 ). Here this species is, for the first time, recorded in Turkey , Armenia , Karachay-Cherkessia, and Kabardino-Balkaria.

Remarks. Kudryashova (1998) supposed that this species and
Xinjiangsha monticola ( Kolebinova, 1974 )
,
comb. nov.
described from Bulgaria were synonyms, but the latter species, though very similar morphometrically, differs from
X. tarda
in lesser number of idiosomal setae (NDV 84 vs. 103–122).
